H0.text: Epithelium provides a rigid shell to prevent punctures, which explains how it offers protection to land‑dwelling vertebrates.

H1.text: Epithelium has capillaries to resist iron deficiency, which explains how the epithelium offers protection to land‑dwelling vertebrates.

H2.text: Epithelium insulates the vertebrate from hypothermia, which explains how the epithelium offers protection to land‑dwelling vertebrates.

H3.text: Epithelium prevents dehydration in land‑dwelling vertebrates.

A4.text: The epidermis itself has no blood supply and is nourished almost exclusively by diffused oxygen from the surrounding air.

A5.text: The epidermal layer regulates the amount of water released from the body into the atmosphere through transepidermal water loss.
